channel.description: The term data binding refers to binding two objects together programmatically so that one has access to the data of the other. We most commonly see this with user interfaces and data objects - the user interface exposes some of the state of the data object to the user. As with many programming tasks, there are a number of ways to approach data binding. The Windows Presentation Foundation in C# has adopted an event and component-based approach that we will explore in this chapter.
